page.title: 15Young Farmers Of Jersey
page.content: In the parish of Trinity lies the Jersey Young Farmers Club. It is a meeting place where farming is discussed and social events organised. On the 6th of July, 1985 the Young Farmers organised a 'Fun on the Farm' fete held at the Howard Davis Farm.This event included agricultural displays and a tractor handling competition. The main highlight of the social calendar is the annual traditional Black Butter making day. The custom of Black Butter making originates from the time when orchards were plentiful in the island for the recipe includes 10 gallons of cider, 20lb of sugar, 3 sticks of finely chopped liquorice, 24 sliced lemons, 700lb of sweet apples and 3lb of allspice. The ingredients are put into a large pan over an open fire and stirred continuously day and night.
